sample_docs: Address Melbourne Office Suite 2B, 80 Keilor Road, Essendon North, Vic 3041 Sydney Office Suite 301, 8 West Street, NORTH SYDNEY, NSW 2060 Contacts Geoff Stockton geoff@pharmacyid.com.au Steve Jackson steve@pharmacyid.com.au Brian Woodham brian@pharmacyid.com.au Dale Bridger dale@pharmacyid.com.au Address Melbourne Office Suite 2B, 80 Keilor Road, Essendon North, Vic 3041 Sydney Office Suite 301, 8 West Street, NORTH SYDNEY, NSW 2060 Suite 2B, 80 Keilor Road, Essendon North, Vic 3041 Suite 301, 8 West Street, NORTH SYDNEY, NSW 2060 Contacts Geoff Stockton geoff@pharmacyid.com.au Steve Jackson steve@pharmacyid.com.au Brian Woodham brian@pharmacyid.com.au Dale Bridger dale@pharmacyid.com.au The Personnel Risk Management Group (The PRM Group) has been established as a company since 1997. It was the first company in Australia to introduce "on-line" or electronic police checks for individuals and corporate clients. The company has grown significantly since then, and now has over 2,000 clients in Australia including a number of Commonwealth and State Government departments. Our Biometrics division was established in 2010 to address the exponential growth of identity fraud in Australia and around the world. Our advanced Biometric identity enrolment and verification solutions provide our clients with practical and functional solutions to solve the problem of identity verification. Visit website > iLearning Group is an innovative e-learning company specialising in community Pharmacy training and education. PharmacyClub.com.au is the leading training and education site for Pharmacy Assistants with over 24,000 members across 4,500 pharmacies, offering PAs a variety of engaging learning activities, QCPP refresher training, and rewards. PharmacistClub.com.au is the new online destination for Australian Pharmacists. Offering free online CPD activities, product and business information, and practical advice and tips to help pharmacists successfully develop their businesses. FAQs Q. What will it cost to join PharmacyID? A. To join PharmacyID now, there is no cost. After this period there may be joining fees, dependent upon the number of pharmacies in your area Q. How much do I get paid to confirm 100 point check for a National Police History Check (NPHC)? A. Your pharmacy will be paid $6 (incl GST) for each NPHC approved. Payment will be made automatically on the first day of each month directly into your account. Q. What's in it for my pharmacy? A. Joining our network will create a strong and powerful identity service for consumers right across Australia. Apart from providing you with income for services that you currently provide for free, we will also be able to drive foot traffic into your pharmacy. Each year more than 3 million people have police checks completed and we want as many of these to come to their local pharmacy as possible. As available services expand throughout the network we expect more and more Australians to identify their local pharmacy as the 'go to' place for identity services. Higher levels of checks will attract higher remuneration. Q. What equipment will a pharmacy need? A. Initially, for police checks, a pharmacist will need no more equipment than they probably already have. Here is a list: Police Checks: Computer connected to the internet and a barcode scanner. You can log on without using a scanner, but it will make the process faster. Identity Cards/Proof of Age: Computer connected to the internet and a barcode scanner Web camera. Appropriate lighting and backdrop: n.b. the software has been written for PharmacyID and will be provided to Pharmacists at no cost. Passports and Visa Applications: The next round of passports will include a digital fingerprint in addition to the ICAO standard photograph. Not all pharmacists will elect to do passports, however, we estimate that if 25% of pharmacies in Australia join the PharmacyID network, we will have a larger number of outlets than the current provider. Computer connected to the internet and a barcode scanner Web camera. Appropriate lighting and backdrop. Digital fingerprint machine. PharmacyID are currently using "touchless†technology which will take a set of fingerprints in less than a minute. The technology is called "finger on the flyâ€. PharmacyID will also be able to provide you with passport photograph printers. You will be able to provide passport photos to individuals, independent of PharmacyID. The printer is DNP DS40 and the cost per set of four prints is approximately 20 cents per set. Q. What other services will PharmacyID provide over time? A. Building the network of active pharmacies is our priority in the first twelve months. Conducting NPHC is only the first of many applications that will generate revenue for your pharmacy. Future applications like passport and visa applications, proof of age cards, and identity verification for banks and other institutions will generate greater revenue for your pharmacy. Q. How will PharmacyID work? A. Establishing a network of pharmacies in Australia is key to building a strong and robust national service. Identity services will commence with witnessing identity documents for the purpose of completing police checks. This service requires no additional hardware and the pharmacy will only require internet access to complete the task. As the person has already paid for their check, once the pharmacy views the identity documents and ticks the relevant box, an invoice is automatically created and the pharmacy is paid for all checks done in a monthly automatic payment. As contracts are signed, more services will be provided. Some may require International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) passport standard photographs being taken. The PRM Group have the software that will take ICAO standard photographs which will be provided to you free of cost. You will need to purchase a web camera (which will be compatible with the software), lighting and a neutral background.Further biometric services such as fingerprints and voice capture will follow. Q. What remuneration does the pharmacy receive? A. We have placed the fee for a police check at $6.00 (includes GST). To take an International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) standard photograph in addition to the 100 point I.D. check, we envisage a payment of $10.00 (includes GST). As the level of service rises, so will the remuneration. As an example: we estimate that future payments for passport applications may be around $25.00 and greater for higher level checks. Q. What are Identity services? A. Identity services can be as simple as witnessing a person's original documents and signing a photocopy to say that it is identical with the original. These types of documents are usually drivers licence's, passports, photographs etc., and are currently being used by government authorities and commercial organisations to identify people. Q. How many NPHC'S will we do in the first twelve months? A. This will be dependent on the local population and your location. We expect basic 100 point ID verification for Police Checks to build over time and for consumers to identify with their local pharmacy for these and other types of services. Q. How do I access the PharmacyID system? A. All you need is a computer/POS with active internet. Q. Who can conduct identity checks in my pharmacy? A. Any trusted employee who has completed the training can conduct identity verification. Q. Do I need training? A. Yes, training is hosted on the PharmacyID website. Q. What sort of training do I need to complete? A. Training is online and video based. The first application is to verify 100 points identity for National Police History Checks. Watch the video, answer a few questions and you are ready to verify a police check. It's that easy! Q. Will I need a user name and password to access the system? A. Yes, we will issue unique user names and password to access the system. Q. Is there a support line or help desk for PharmacyID? A. Yes, PharmacyID has a team of consultants who are trained and experienced in all facets of identity verification. Our 1300 YES ITS ME (1300 937 487) number is the central contact for all enquiries. We can also be contacted at info@pharmacyID.com.au Q. What happens if a customer does not have 100 points of identification? A. If a customer does not have enough points to confirm identity we cannot complete the transaction. During the application process they will be informed of what they need to take to the pharmacy. Q. Can the pharmacy create an application or account for a customer? A. No. The system is user driven and all customers must create an account and pay for the service online before attending the pharmacy. Q. Can the pharmacy change an existing user application or account? A. No. Only the customer or PharmacyID consultants can alter/modify their account. Q. How does PharmacyID manage privacy? A. Information we receive about individuals will never be disclosed to any other organisation, company etc., for any purpose counter to the individuals privacy. This is due to, in some instances, legislation. For instance, you are not permitted by law to disclose information about people in regard to police checks they have submitted. Additionally, the directors of PharmacyID are adamant about maintaining people's privacy and security. Over 120 organisations in Victoria alone use your driver's licence as a form of identity, and they often photocopy the licence. Every time you permit someone to copy your driver's licence you are potentially giving away your identity. PharmacyID are serious about maintaining people's privacy, unlike organisations that sell your information to companies overseas. PharmacyID will never sell, give away, permit access to, any information about Pharmacists, or PharmacyID clients to anyone, unless provided for by the law. n.b. You will see privacy items mentioned in your contract. Q. Will I need to complete training for each new service that is introduced? A. Training for each new service will only be required if new identity functions are needed. The identity verification system will always have the same look and feel. As services are added, the system will be enhanced with additional function boxes that will prompt new activity. e.g. proof of identity card: Identity verification is the same but new training will be required on how to take an ICAO standard photograph. Q. Does the Pharmacy Guild of Australia know about this project? A. Yes, PharmacyID has met with the PGA who are supportive of any opportunity to increase the value of the pharmacy network and help pharmacies diversify their businesses and remain profitable. Q. Will PharmacyID be at APP in 2015? A. Yes PharmacyID will be at stand 336 at APP in 2015. Q. Who are PharmacyID partners? A. Some of PharmacyID partners are: Sagem/Morpho: Touchless fingerprintmachines, RMIT: Testing and development of Biometric Security etc, AB Note: AB Note currently produce most of the drivers licences, MasterCard's, Visa cards etc., Australia wide, and they are keen to assist PharmacyID in providing high level security identity cards for universities, schools, hospitals, commercial organisations and emergency management organisations such as the CFA and SES. Imagus Technology: Facial recognition, VedaleonTechnologies: Airline booking systems and self-service solutions, Auraya Systems Pty Ltd: Voice recognition, iP Edge: Web development and systems... ...and many, many more. We understand that you may have many more questions in relation to PharmacyID. Please don't hesitate to contact us or call our administration team for any further questions you may have. Q. Vision Building a strong network for the future PharmacyID is a new Australian owned business which offers consumers a more efficient, secure and trusted identity service through their local community pharmacy. Consumers are constantly required to prove their identity for a large number of services with government and commercial businesses. Because of this, protection of personal information is now more important than ever. Giving away personal information to multiple organisations increases the risk of someone stealing your identity information. PharmacyID brings together the power of the community pharmacy network in Australia (regardless of brand or ownership) with state-of-the-art identity verification technology to solve these problems. Harnessing the trust and value of the community pharmacy network is key to providing this new service to the Australian market where only one service provider currently exists. Many pharmacies already provide basic identity services for free as a community service but this industry currently generates over $1 billion dollars a year. About PharmacyID A new, simple and valuable revenue stream PharmacyID is the brainchild of Geoff Stockton (MD of The PRM Group). After 22 years of service as a Victorian Police Officer and Inspector, Geoff has always been passionate about eliminating identity fraud and providing a more efficient and effective way for Australians to protect their identity. PharmacyID is an identity service company born from a partnership between The PRM Group and The iLearning Group facilitated by a strategic network of community pharmacies right around Australia who provide the services at a retail level. A new national identity service facilitated by pharmacies all over Australia will give us the ability to provide existing services to the community such as national police history checks and future services that may include, passport and visa applications, licence renewals, proof of age cards, confirmation of identity for retail purchases, banking and finance transactions and identity verification for domestic and international travel. Joining the pharmacy network makes good business sense. PharmacyID provides Australian Government, business and consumers with a more efficient, secure and trusted identity service through their local community pharmacy. Identity verification has become a standard requirement in the set up of personal accounts with service providers on and offline. However, giving away personal information to multiple organisations increases the risk of someone stealing identity information. Current verification of identity systems have limitations and serious flaws that are targeted by criminals. PharmacyID brings together the power of the community pharmacy network in Australia with state-of-the-art identity verification technology to solve these problems quickly, efficiently and with absolute security. PharmacyID now offers the most secure national identity system for services such as national police history checks and future services that may include passport and visa applications, licence renewals, proof of age cards, confirmation of identity for retail purchases, banking and finance transactions and identity verification for domestic and international travel. Applicants are not giving away their identity The recipient is not receiving false certified documents There is a complete verification and audit trail Quick, easy and secure PharmacyID has been designed and developed by The PRM Group, one of Australia's most trusted identity verification businesses. The PRM Group is accredited by the Commonwealth Government to provide National Police Check (NPC) services for companies, government and private individuals. Find out how PharmacyID can help:

As you read the details of what the Document Verification Service ( DVS ), how it operates and how you can benefit from the service, please note that PharmacyID is a Gateway Service Provider for the DVS . PharmacyID is aware that many organisations do not have access to the DVS and have offered their services to these organisations via a free API. The cost of the service is then simply a transactional agreement with no software / development costs. Please call us if we can assist you accessing the DVS. PharmacyID is a Verification of Identity (VoI) service provider, a developer of innovative VOID solutions, and therefore DVS access is built into most of our services. For example, when a police check is done via PharmacyID, the documents used to identify the applicant are verified via the DVS. The DVS is a nationa Document Verification Service As you read the details of what the Document Verification Service ( DVS ), how it operates and how you can benefit from the service, please note that PharmacyID is a Gateway Service Provider for the DVS . PharmacyID is aware that many organisations do not have access to the DVS and have offered their services to these organisations via a free API. The cost of the service is then simply a transactional agreement with no software / development costs. Please call us if we can assist you accessing the DVS. PharmacyID is a Verification of Identity (VoI) service provider, a developer of innovative VOID solutions, and therefore DVS access is built into most of our services. For example, when a police check is done via PharmacyID, the documents used to identify the applicant are verified via the DVS. DVS The DVS is a national online system, operated via the Commonwealth Department of Home Affairs, that allows organisations to compare a customer's identifying information with a government record. The DVS is a secure system that operates 24/7 and matches key details contained on Australian-issued identifying credentials, providing a 'yes' or 'no' answer within seconds. The DVS helps organisations build greater confidence in the identities of their clients. This helps protect governments, businesses and Australians from identity crime. How the DVS works The Document Verification Service (DVS) confirms the details on an evidence of identity document match records held by the government authority issuer. The DVS checks if the details are still valid. The DVS does not: Make a decision on a person's identity Provide access to an issuer's database Verify the authenticity of physical documents Verify identities of clients presenting those documents Verify documents for individuals—only approved organisations can use the DVS. Within seconds , the DVS can validate documents and credentials issued by Australian Government, State and Territory government agencies. Verifiable Documents The following Australian evidence of identity credentials can be matched through the DVS: Birth certificates* Centrelink concession Cards Certificates of registration by descent Change of name certificates* Citizenship certificates Driver licences ImmiCards Marriage certificates* Medicare cards Passports Visas * These documents will be available for matching by both government and non-government users for jurisdictions as they come online. Please refer to Addendum 2 of the Business User for document availability. The Matching Process The DVS matching process involves a user, gateway service provider, issuer and the DVS hub: User — an organisation authorised to use the DVS to match identifying information. Gateway Service Provider — an organisation authorised to direct information match requests to and from the DVS Hub on behalf of approved users. ( i. e. PharmacyID ) Issuer — an organisation that issues the identifying information (also known as the official record holder). DVS Hub — a technical router that securely directs requests between users and issuers. For further information or to arrange a demonstration, please contact PharmacyID on 1300 937 487 or email info@pharmacyid.com.au . As you read the details of what the Document Verification Service ( DVS ), how it operates and how you can benefit from the service, please note that PharmacyID is a Gateway Service Provider for the DVS . PharmacyID is aware that many organisations do not have access to the DVS and have offered their services to these organisations via a free API. The cost of the service is then simply a transactional agreement with no software / development costs. Please call us if we can assist you accessing the DVS. PharmacyID is a Verification of Identity (VoI) service provider, a developer of innovative VOID solutions, and therefore DVS access is built into most of our services. For example, when a police check is done via PharmacyID, the documents used to identify the applicant are verified via the DVS. The DVS is a national online system, operated via the Commonwealth Department of Home Affairs, that allows organisations to compare a customer's identifying information with a government record. The DVS is a secure system that operates 24/7 and matches key details contained on Australian-issued identifying credentials, providing a 'yes' or 'no' answer within seconds. The DVS helps organisations build greater confidence in the identities of their clients. This helps protect governments, businesses and Australians from identity crime.
